channel.title: Iran on Logos and brands
channel.description: Recent content in Iran on Logos and brands

item.title: House of Cinema
item.description: House of Cinema is Iranian Alliance of Motion Picture Guilds. Organization was founded in 1989. Source

item.title: Offset Press
item.description: Offset Press Inc., Also known as OPI, is an Iranian corporation that develops, manufactures, and distributes analogue and digital products and systems for the making, processing, and reproduction of images. While the demographic of the corporation has changed with time, OPI initially started developing text books. The company operates publicly in Iran, being listed on the Tehran Stock Exchange since 1990. Source

item.title: SAIPA
item.description: SAIPA is an Iranian automaker headquartered in Tehran. The SAIPAC was established in 1965 as with 75% Iranian ownership, to assemble CitroÃ«ns under license for the Iranian market. It changed its name into SAIPA in 1975 when the Iranian state withdrew from the company. Its products in recent years have been mostly under-licensed Korean cars and its own engine and range of cars. The chief executive of SAIPA is Mohammadali Teimouri.
